"We believed the intelligence was correct," Mr. Donald Rumsfeld said in an interview on ABC's "Good Morning America" with George Stephanopoulos , the former Democratic politico turned broadcaster. It turns out that it was not completely correct, although the inspectors did go in and determine that Saddam Hussein did, in fact, have the capability of fairly rapidly reconstituting his chemical and biological capabilities. to take his British programme The X Factor to America this year, and speculation is rife over who will judge it. Jane Lynch insists the rumours can now end, as she has the perfect solution. People have asked me, "What about having Sue on The X Factor? How would she do?' I think she'd be fantastic- and there would be a few contestants reduced to tears, she laughed. "It can never happen, though. Simon Cowell and Sue on the same judging panel will never work in a million years- there"s only room for one ego on the show!

two cars and$ 40,000 in cash. Eric Schmidt took bribes from Iraqi vendors and in one case allegedly changed a contract to deliver less exercise equipment than was paid for, the Times said. The Schmidts defrauded U.S. taxpayers, cheated the Iraqi people and betrayed the trust placed in them, said Stuart Bowen , special inspector general for Iraq reconstruction. Richard Prather , a retired auto worker from Anderson, said after the Pendleton town hall that he believed Mike Pence 's reputation as a federal spending hawk would serve him well running for the governor's office. I think he would have been a good candidate for president, but I'm glad he didn't, Richard Prather said. "In the next race, he can run for president." Allen Iverson had 32 points and 12 assists Wednesday night, and the Nuggets used a late run to beat the Grizzlies 106-102. This was a big win for us at somebody else's home, Allen Iverson said. Italia' "We are getting closer and closer to the workers in the Charlie Chaplin movies," said Nina Leone, 47, a Fiat employee since 1988 and who said she would oppose the deal. I don't think Mirafiori will stop auto production if the No vote prevails. We will fight to keep our jobs. Mirafiori is part of Sergio Marchionne 's 20 billion-euro investment project dubbed "Fabbrica Italia" to revamp Fiat's five remaining Italian car plants excluding Termini Imerese, which will stop producing cars by the end of 2011
